p: In Alaska, cases of human disease caused by Echinococcus species (both granulosus and multilocularis) are reportable to the SOE. Since the 1950s, over 300 cases of echinococcosis were reported ( 46). Since 1990, only eight cases of E. granulosus and no cases of E. multilocularis have been reported ( 46). Because cases may be asymptomatic, the actual number of infections could be higher. In Alaska, there were 193 (mostly Alaska Native) cases diagnosed up until 1980, and various reports document similar numbers from various regions of northern Canada ( 47).
